thread.title: More super funds tipped to bring funds in-house as Cbus eyes direct deals
thread.title_full: More super funds tipped to bring funds in-house as Cbus eyes direct deals | afr.com

author: Sally Rose with and Jemima Whyte
title: More super funds tipped to bring funds in-house as Cbus eyes direct deals
text:
ACSI chief executive Louise Davidson tips more super funds will engage with companies directly to encourage long-term investing. Josh Robenstone by Sally Rose with and Jemima Whyte Cbus is the latest superannuation fund set to bring more of its investment management in-house in a bid to use its scale to urge company boards to think longer term.
The trend is tipped to continue amid rising concerns that short term pressure on capital returns is crimping growth.
Australian Council of Superannuation Investors chief executive Louise Davidson said super funds were increasingly side-stepping the middle man of the funds management industry to use their financial clout to urge company boards focus on more than the next dividend payment or quarterly result.
"A lot of boards want to be able to concentrate on those issues but financial markets at the moment emphasise the short-term outcomes," Ms Davidson said.
QSuper, AustralianSuper, and UniSuper are among other top 10 super funds that have already brought management of some their investments in-house.
Direct funding Cbus head of investment strategy Kristian Fok said that in addition to bringing part of its Australian equities portfolio in-house, his fund will also consider providing direct funding to listed companies for capital projects, or underwriting issuance of hybrids or debt.
"As a long-term provider of patient capital we are aware of and concerned about companies' lack of investment," he said.
 Former Nomura Asset Management portfolio manager Kiran Singh who begins work next week in the newly created role of investment specialist equities will work closely with Mr Fok and his head of public markets Brett Chatfield on a major review before putting a plan before the investment committee.
